name: secondment
content:

a period of time when an employee is sent to work somewhere else, to increase the number of workers , to replace other workers, or to exchange experience or skills: His involvement with the project began when he was on (a) secondment from NASA to the European Space Agency. See
second
More examplesFewer examplesA member of the company's eastern Europe group, who has been on secondment in Berlin, Bratislava and Budapest, gave an informed overview of publishing in the region.You may find you have to work away from home on secondment. When their secondment came to an end, 22 returned to their former jobs, 7 continued their secondments, and 14 moved to another employer.The fellowships are offered as secondments for a term.
